title: 107_hr2252
content: The Act titled "Conduit Contribution Prevention Act of 2001" increases penalties for violations of conduit contribution ban. The Act "Conduit Contribution Prevention Act of 2001" increases civil and criminal penalties for knowing and willful violations of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971. Civil penalties are now not less than 300 percent of the amount involved in the violation and not more than the greater of $50,000 or 1000 percent of the amount involved. Criminal penalties have also been increased for those who knowingly and willfully commit violations. The Act "Conduit Contribution Prevention Act of 2001" increases penalties for violations of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971. Civil penalties are now not less than 300 percent of the amount involved and not more than $50,000 or 1000 percent of the amount. Criminal penalties have also been increased for knowing and willful violations. The United States Sentencing Commission shall promulgate guidelines for penalties for violations of section 320 of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971, considering variations in the contribution amount. They must also submit an explanation to Congress for any guidelines promulgated or amended. The United States Sentencing Commission is required to create guidelines for penalties related to violations of section 320 of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971, taking into account differences in contribution amounts. The Commission must also provide an explanation to Congress for any guidelines issued or revised. The amendments made to the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 include changes to referral procedures to the Attorney General for violations of section 320, an extension of the statute of limitations to 5 years for section 320 violations, and an effective date for these amendments to apply to violations occurring after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3 extends the ban on foreign contributions to all campaign-related disbursements under the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971. The amendments apply to disbursements made after the enactment of this Act.
